messages.subject: re:what dogs eat (don't read if YOU are eating)
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/30/02 8:20:17 AM, shyrley.williams@verizon.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/30/02 8:20:17 AM, shyrley.williams@... writes:

<< My Shih Tzu once ate all the choclate decorations from the xmas
tree when he was 2. Apart from the unusual turds he was fine and
live until he was 15 >>

Our dog has twice stolen foil-wrapped Christmas or Easter candy, and poops
foil lumps in regular-looking turds. She's not a tiny dog, nor a giant one.
Blue heeler, I can pick her up.

Just because something CAN be poison to a dog or a person doesn't mean it
always is. I have friends allergic to nuts. Nuts are poison to some people.
Strawberries are poison to some people.

I don't feed my dog chocolate, but I don't freak out when she finds some or a
kid shares a candy bar with her out on a hike or something.

I've never had a dog die of anything but old age or getting hit by a car.

As to birds and Teflon, birds are stuck in cages, and can't get away from
noxious fumes. Many are very small and die easily (coal mine evidence).

Sandra
